WorkItem.ClosedComment: Fixed in changeset 45529.All rawr warlock spell calculations are now matching the results seen ingame if you have the DrDamage addon installed. I also added a lot of useful theorycrafting information into the tooltips to make it easy to spot differences between Rawr.Warlock vs DrDamage results incase something changes, or if I have missed something.There will be some differences with the AOE spells though, but those are not important because you would not be using AOE spells in your pve boss rotation anyway (aoe spells are just included to give an overall picture of warlock damage).
WorkItem.Description:
Affliction spec, and the only spell that's not WILDLY off is Shadowbolt.
Â 
Number comparison of my spells vs. what rawr says for them is in 'Lucifel spells.txt'
Profile for testing purposes is in 'Lucifel_2_3_5.xml'.

Comments.Message: Just a note, this makes a 4.5k-ish dps set-up calculate out to be 1145 dps. Pretty big impact.

Yes indeed - I cleaned up some code and in the process of doing that, I screwed up the tickdamage calculations, so overall results are pretty ... wrong ...

Feel free to /facepalm @ me :)

Heh. I'm sure you've headdesked enough over that one as it is.

On a more encouraging note, hey, at least it's change, and that's a good sign.
Kind of like reorganizing a storage closet. It eventually looks much tidier, but first it gets much much worse for a bit.

Here's hoping you get that fixed and a new rawr comes out soon. :)

I like the analogy of renovating your kitchen.  The old kitchen sucks.  The new kitchen will be awesome.  But until it's awesome, you gotta tear out the old cabinets, punch new holes in walls, and disconnect the refrigerator to let the new one come in.

Warlocks can complain all they want that this version is worse than the last version, but the last version was unusable so...that's not really possible.  And at least shit's getting done now ;)

Well, this one's entirely broken, compared to the last one which was at least *sort of* usable. To continue the kitchen analogy, the fridge still kept things cool, the oven still cooked things, even if not consistently. Now we've just gotta eat out and wait. It'll be worth it though.

heh - I like that analogy :)

The good news is that the spell values are fixed now [@midnightlynx - I have this feeling that you are going to recognise the new (and very much improved) tooltips in the upcoming version :)]
Any news on when we will see the spell values released. Is much anticipated here as its hard to be sure that the items we are seeing as improvements are true until DPS values are what they should be.

This will be checked in to SVN today. Just busy rechecking some individual spells under diff pve specs.

While we're on this topic - hands up if anyone here is using the DrDamage addon.
-> http://wow.curse.com/downloads/wow-addons/details/dr-damage.aspx

If so, you will be pleased to know that the new Rawr Warlock tooltips contains pretty much the same information that you will find ingame via the DrDamage tooltips!! Its not exactly the same layout as DrDamage, but very similar, which makes validating the results a piece of cake!!

I did discover a mistake in DrDamage though - currently it does not take into account the 5% increased spell damage from demonic pact (meta/ruin locks)] - but apart from that (and some very minor differences due to rounding), the new Rawr spell values are matching DrDamage :)
a minor delay - there was an update for DrDamage, so i'm rechecking everything 1 more time ... :/
